page.title: 12 Canada,West Wellow.
page.content: Canada is part of Wellow.The majority of residents do not think that the A36 splits the community from the rest of Wellow. Building must have started in the early C.19th.The earliest building we recorded was the"Rockingham Arms" public house,built in 1840.The houses are mainly Victorian with eight rooms and two acres gardens. The modern buildings,mostly bungalows,were built between 1950 and 1970.They have aprox.one third of an acre of garden.Canada is so called because the workers on Embley Estate decided to move,the more adventurous people emigrated to Canada(N.America). The poorer people bought plots of land (plantations)from the Duchess of Chandra and built on them.This was their "Canada" and the name stuck. by R.Heath,D.Moore,A.Jones,S.Cassar
